Key Match Events: Juan Soto threw out a runner at home plate in the first inning
The Yankees tied the score and took a 4-3 lead on a pair of bases-loaded walks in the fifth inning
Alex Verdugo's sixth-inning leadoff walk was followed by a single from Juan Soto that moved Verdugo into scoring position for Austin Wells to deliver the two-out RBI single that tied the score at 5-5
Pre-Game Insights: The fans showed up today, it was electric
The Yankees are trying to pass the baton, take our walks. We aren’t trying to hit five-run homers
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone said 'They’re set up big time right there if they score that run. That was a big play'
Juan Soto said 'We showed today that we aren’t trying to be selfish, We are trying to pass the baton, take our walks. We aren’t trying to hit five-run homers'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Juan Soto had three hits and a RBI single
The game was played in front of 48,970 fans
Others: The Yankees beat the Royals, 6-5, in Game 1 of the ALDS
